review.title: “ok company”
review.pros: Pros – starting pay is a little above average, fast paced most of the time, break every two hours,good for a second job.
review.cons: Cons – raises suck, do not give enough hours to run store properly,and they want things done a certain way but dont allow you to have enough people to get it done then if you go into overtime they get mad.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – allow more hours per week so the shifts can be staffed properly

review.title: “Not a bad part-time job”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible hours. I could request important days off. Time and a half on holidays. Nice people. Good part-time job for students or young people.
review.cons: Cons – Pay is not great. Received only a 10-cents raise after 6 months at minimum wage. Definitely needed a second job. Only a manager (not even an assistant manager) made enough to hold one job. Not a great job for parents or major bread-winners. I hear they are cutting hours under 30 per week so they don't have to comply with Obamacare rules. When I was working here in 2012 I could always count on 38 or 39 hours per week.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Try to raise pay (or benefits) for employees that have been around a long time.

review.title: “overwhellming”
review.pros: Pros – great customers able to work
review.cons: Cons – poor management make it hard to work
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – work on communication

review.title: “long hours lots of work”
review.pros: Pros – circle k is always looking for people and advancement, but be patient to move up.
review.cons: Cons – long hours, on call 24/7/365, vacation time is decent especially when tenured
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – remember where you came from, most upper management were former store managers.

review.title: “My experience at Circle K was okay.”
review.pros: Pros – Always got to do something different. For example, you were not always behind the counter, but instead you might be stocking the coolers.
review.cons: Cons – They never let anyone go more than 40 hours a week and if you did you would get into some serious trouble. The only time 2 people were allowed behind the counter was when it was busy. Even when everything in the store was done.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat your employees like humans and not like garbage. Make a list for your employees to do and not boss them around as soon as they start their shift.

review.title: “Looking for a career in C-Stores? Go to QuikTrip”
review.pros: Pros – The company doesn't perform drug tests, so if you're a habitual drug user, you have a future at Circle K.
review.cons: Cons – Recently, management at Circle K's Tucson headquarters changed. At the same time, a competing store chain, QuikTrip, entered town, and they're devouring Circle K whole. As a result, the new company motto of Circle K is "Be like Quiktrip, but don't spend any money doing it." They want their thirty-year old stores to look as nice as QuikTrip's, without renovating them or replacing any of their antique equipment. They want their employees to be like QuikTrip's employees while only paying them minimum wage. The management is overbearing, micromanaging, and eager to fire.Assistant Managers are expected to be available and on call 24 hours a day, but they can't get overtime, so an Assistant might get called on an hour's notice to come work a graveyard shift, and would have their hours cut the next time they worked so they don't recieve any extra compensation for the disruption to their lives.What makes this all the more frustrating is that prior to the management change, Circle K was actually a decent place to work for. Not perfect by any stretch of the imagination, but every problem I just described was created by the new management. These days, if you're in Tucson and want a job, you would serve yourself better going to work for one of Circle K's competitors.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Learn where your desks are and stay behind them. I can't imagine much of your own work is getting done when you spend all of your time badgering your employees about doing theirs.

review.title: “Stressful with amount that's required, low pay”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible schedules and depending on the manager can be enjoyable. Sometimes stressful with its standards.
review.cons: Cons – Low pay for the amount of work required. Hard to want to stay when cost of living is so high.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Look at pay rate for assistant managers, 8.50 per hour is horrible compared to most jobs.

review.title: “Job is a joke”
review.pros: Pros – I cant think of any...
review.cons: Cons – Crappy Pay, Crappy people, You have to give your life to these people
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Try looking at other gas stations to see how they should be running

review.title: “Never Again!!”
review.pros: Pros – None in my experience. Insurance package was decently priced,but I could never get time off to keep appointments.
review.cons: Cons – Training program a joke, hardly anyone finishes the 12 week training before being put in a store. I was told one salary and first paycheck when I went on salary was almost $100 less,DM flat out lied,no support from DM or other managers. This company will work you to the bone and you will have no life outside of it.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Monitor District Managers and keep on touch with area managers that need help with staffing issues.

review.title: “It was horrible.”
review.pros: Pros – You were always close to a gas station. And got to meet really interesting people.
review.cons: Cons – The bathroom, People never showed up for work, You never got moved up, no bonuses.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Fun, simple and straightforward job requirements.”
review.pros: Pros – Get to meet a plethora of people and a good chance to network.
review.cons: Cons – Working in a low income area attracts transients and rowdy children.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire more employees full-time.

review.title: “Very laid back, nice coworkers, great atmosphere!”
review.pros: Pros – My particular store was always clean, coworkers were enjoyable, easy tasks, decent pay for a starting job.
review.cons: Cons – Working holidays, an employee or two were not good employees, but hat happens.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep it up!

review.title: “Lowest of the low in many ways”
review.pros: Pros – ....a free cup of coffee
review.cons: Cons – You will attend mandatory meetings that you will provide your own transportation and cost of fuel to attend with no reimbursement. At times they may be an hours drive. The Market Managers don't have interpersonal skills. Some will use foul language frequently, some will try to meddle in your store unnecessarily. Many of them got their skills growing up on third shift at Circle K as entry level employees. You will be required to maintain all aspects of the store, scrubbing and plunging toilets, cleaning gas pumps...if your store has a roadsign with the price, you will have to change it with a pole which is very unsafe as they often fly down and you have to dodge them or be nailed in the head. Sadly, many employees are dishonest because the company pays the minimum wage and if some managers can cheat you out of hours by getting you to do a little for nothing (working off the clock) they will take advantage of you. You will count every package and carton of cigarettes in the store every week. Perks? NONE...oh, yea, you get a free cup of coffee if you bring your own cup or a free soda if you bring your own cup. If your looking to go into management of one of these stores, you should know, after working 65-80 hours a week, you will still be expected to visit your store on your personal time, known as a "night ride" twice a week and make a report of such on location at time of visit. Forget about enjoying a day at the beach.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Educate yourself in interpersonal skills, because you are required to work 18 hours a day, don't take it out on your staff.

review.title: “good place to work”
review.pros: Pros – you can climb up the ladder pretty fast
review.cons: Cons – management unstable, a lot of stress for store manger
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – get some better upper mangement skill

review.title: “Low morale and multiple changes ruined a previously good position.”
review.pros: Pros – Fairly flexible schedule assuming you have a good district manager who will work with you on it.
review.cons: Cons – The expectations were becoming more and more unrealistic, many managers had only a few days off over the course of a few months.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Quit adding more and more to the job without taking away a few of the tasks. When hours were cut and managers needed to run register more often that took away from the multitude of other tasks that we are given.

review.title: “Upper management is disconnected from the reality of running a store.”
review.pros: Pros – Benefits (health, dental, 401K, vacation).
review.cons: Cons – Ridiculous expectations based on number of labor hours given to run an efficient store.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Work in a store for one week to understand what it truly takes to run a store. Work at a store at two different types of stores. One that has lower socio-economic clients and one that has higher socio-economic clients.

review.title: “Don't Work Here, Especially Not on Third Shift”
review.pros: Pros – -An extra dollar for third shift-Nice co-workers
review.cons: Cons – -Poor pay-Poor upper management-Poor treatmentI worked for Circle K for just under a year. Though I can't argue much for other shifts, third shift was particularly bad compared to other jobs and the occasional second shift I might have picked up. I was trained for four days before being put on third shift by myself. Without a coworker to ask, I was left to fend for myself on any new tasks, customer questions and register making many customers angry. For instance, I wasn't shown how to complete a refund until I'd been working there for about a month.Aside from the substandard training, there were many safety concerns. BGSU is a heavy drinking college and my store was just around the corner from all of the bars. I felt more comfortable than most girls feel working alone, but even I felt uncomfortable with the large amount of drunk students yelling at me, trying to touch me, flirting with me or damaging property within the store. While I never expected that to change (there's only so much you can do being so close to a college and many bars), I never felt it would have been a problem to have someone stay until the bars closed every night or some kind of minor security. After the bars closed, I was fine because the students went home, but except for Friday and Saturday, I was on my own to deal with many drunk students who often started fights in the store or the parking lot, who shoplifted or, again, damaged property.I never received breaks because they never let me work with anyone. If I wanted to eat, I had to do so between customers. I wasn't allowed to sit down at all even if the store was empty. One co-worker, who was 7-8 months pregnant was told to stop sitting down between customers though her doctor told her she wasn't to stand for long periods of time.If I didn't finish all of my work by the time I was supposed to leave, I had to stay over and finish while getting yelled at. I was capable of doing the work on any night except for Friday and Saturday due to the huge influx of customers from the bars. Eventually I learned that the only way for me to go home on time was to skimp on my duties and try to finish them on other nights because I couldn't get all of it done.If people shoplifted in the store, I got in trouble for not noticing them even if I was at the counter helping someone else. There's only so much one person can do.If you were sick and no one was available to cover your shift, you either had to suck it up and work or (if you worked with someone else that day) your coworker worked alone. For a time, I had one second shift every week. Once, my coworker was sick and had to leave customers frequently to vomit and I sent him home because the managers wouldn't and I was on my own during my day shift.Other times, when they sell the balloons or pumpkins for charity, if you didn't sell enough each shift (usually around 30) you got in trouble.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Try to remember that people, not machines, work for you. There's only so much any person can do and yelling at them for every mistake isn't going to help at all.

review.title: “Horrible, do not work here”
review.pros: Pros – It's a job, that's about allFlexible schedule
review.cons: Cons – Long shiftsWorking by yourselfHorrible pay for the workExpecting you to not only handle all customers, but also keep the store straight, the money in order, and all your additional tasksFirst time your money is short you're out of thereI was fired today after working only 6 nights over 3 weeks(this is a 2nd side job so I was only working 2-3 days a week). My 3rd night I was left by myself for an entire 8 hour shift and everything went to hell and all I heard about the next day was how my money and lottery was unacceptably short. But I came back, did better for 2 nights, then last night I was by myself again, thought everything went decent, but today when I arrive after driving all the way over there(a 20 mile trip), I got wrote up for the incident the 3rd night... and that led into me being short on the money/lottery last night with no proof(I understood the first time because I made mistakes but not here), and an automatic firing. I am disgusted with this company and have a LOT of respects for people who do cashier work in gas stations now. The managers pretty much just sit in their little office and shuffle papers, and go home by 3pm. Fair warning to everyone out there, do not work here!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat people better, or you're not gonna have any employees

review.title: “Worst place to work for! And I'll never come close to any CK stores in my life! And I would not recommend it to anybody.”
review.pros: Pros – There were some hard working people I worked with..
review.cons: Cons – Very dangerous especially when you're working alone. You have to work in the cash register, fill cooler, fill merchandise on the sales floor, clean store, and it can be scary especially at night.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Practice what you preach!!!

review.title: “Just getting worse.”
review.pros: Pros – -Guaranteed forty hours for Store Assistants, thirty for everyone else.-A week of paid vacation after a year of employment, two weeks after three years.
review.cons: Cons – -Poor or non-existent company culture, varies by store and Market Manager-Hard workers aren't appreciated, employees treated like dogs by upper management-My high volume store lost hours weekly, horribly understaffed-Terrible customer service because of being understaffed. Inability to properly maintain the store, provide customer assistance, and keep a clean appearance.-Went through four managers in two and a half years. They're mistreated just like every other employee in the store.-Market Managers are manipulative, liars, and backstabbers.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Employees are people, not dogs. Show the slightest bit of appreciation for hard work instead of the constant nitpicking and yelling about minor store flaws.

review.title: “Interesting”
review.pros: Pros – They have benefit packages for full and part-time, advancement opportunities
review.cons: Cons – Working alone, entry level is relativity on the lower end of the pay scale
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Remember your employees make you, don't forget to recognize them.

review.title: “customer service”
review.pros: Pros – The chance for advancement is very rewarding and they promote within the company.
review.cons: Cons – Management is not on the same page.....You get contradicting information whenever something new comes into place. Customer service reps are not given correct information.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – They need to get their story straight and provide correct information. Maybe hold more meetings so the reps are not being told different things and are properly informed.

review.title: “Good Store...not so good company.”
review.pros: Pros – I worked with a fantastic group of people and an amazing manager (whom I will not forget).Had a nice store, a bit under staffed, but kept us busy.Also had quite a few great customers that came in all the time and they made the job worth it.
review.cons: Cons – Had some difficulty with members of the corporate structure and other area stores...a lot of drama involved in between stores.Also had some very nasty customers, which sometimes resulted in calls to police.

review.title: “My favorite job”
review.pros: Pros – Circle K is willing to give you as much, if not more, as you are willing to give to the company. As long as you are capable of doing your job, you have the opportunity for full time hours, and given time, advancement opportunities, as well. If you don't want to work for your money, want to complain about absolutely everything, or want to just have a horrible working attitude altogether, then no, Circle K is not for you; this behavior really isn't tolerated. This is a job that requires multi-tasking, dedication, integrity, customer service, and common sense.
review.cons: Cons – Hours are competitive, here. This is not an issue for me, but it seems to be a popular concern, so I will address it. You will achieve full-time hours because of one, or more, of the following:A.) You have an open, flexible scheduleB.) You work your butt off on every shift, causing management to depend on you to get stuff doneC.) Your store is extremely low on employees/people are on vacationYes, it is extremely beneficial to your cause if you are able to work multiple shifts. The manager (and even managers from other stores) can depend on you to cover call offs, or the shifts that other employees' schedules won't allow them to work. This alone gives you a giant boost in image. If you actually complete your shift duties, that boosts your image, as well. You don't have to run around like crazy and stress yourself out all the time; just don't be a slacker. Use your time wisely, don't stand around like an idiot--do your job. If you owned a business, and paid people to work for you, how would you want them to work? Would you want them to put forth some effort for your money? Or just stand around, complaining about how unfair work is? Work isn't meant to be "fair". How many crappy employees do we know that get by on just the minimal amount of work allowed (causing us to have to work that much harder)? Now imagine that, in a "perfect" world, they had one year's seniority over you. In this "perfect" world where you work your butt off to pick up where they slack, you get to watch sadly as they get promoted, simply because they're employed longer. Not so perfect, is it?
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I love my job, and I feel like five stars are definitely deserved.

review.title: “Typical minimum wage job”
review.pros: Pros – The job was ridiculously easy. Co-workers were pretty cool to work with. We got paid every week instead of bi-weekly.
review.cons: Cons – Same cons as any other gas station. Drug dealers and addicts hanging around. Managers that keep getting fired for stealing money.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Not a good company to work for”
review.pros: Pros – Good co workersWorked around schoolWeekly pay
review.cons: Cons – Horrible payManagement expected too much and constantly insulted and yelled at employees in front of customersBenefits are terribleRude customersThe only way to get promoted is to brown noseVery high turnover rate in my nine months there were 2 managers and 4 people quit/transferred
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The customers is not always right, just because you get a complaint does not mean that the employee necessary did anything wrong

review.title: “work hard, management will get a bonus. not you.”
review.pros: Pros – There were a few pros when this was still Holland Oil, but it sold to Circle K back in 2007. Unfortunately, Circle K didn't take the opportunity to get rid of the supervisors (Pokorny) when they had the chance and now these people are still there, and the job is worse.
review.cons: Cons – The pay is a slave wage....raises are about 15 cents a year. and there's a salary cap for anyone who isn't management. Speaking of management, they get really nice bonuses on the backs of their employees, who get nothing when the store looks great and the numbers are good.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You really shouldn't expect as much as you do from employees you don't pay well. Some employees have put in decades of service and barely make $10 an hour. That's pathetic. Management shouldn't get bonuses or vacations based on the performance of their underpayed employees.

review.title: “Professionals need not apply, if your smart...”
review.pros: Pros – Weekly pay and decent benefits.My staff is awesome. They work long hours alone but stand up to the task and try to complete all their assignments.
review.cons: Cons – Company runs their stores with a culture of threats and intimidation towards their managers. The lack of respect is palpable. Terrible communication between all levels of management. As a manager you will be told you need to work 50 hours/week but, in reality, if you want to complete everything you are required to complete, you will need to work much much more. Do not expect any positive feedback for a job well done, you will not get any. You will have to be happy with no negativity.I know I sound like a disgruntled employee but I REALLY want to let any prospective managers know that this is the worst company for which I have ever had the displeasure to work. (Over 20 years with the previous owners) I was not directly hired by them but our stores were purchased by the company and i was promised a job. I should have taken unemployment. I will be leaving the company soon as I have found a position elsewhere.If you have to work for Circle K because it is the only paycheck you have coming in, you have my utmost sympathy.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “ok place to work”
review.pros: Pros – advancement oppertunity due to low pay
review.cons: Cons – VERY bad health insurance- it will not cover anything. do not waste your money.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – pay more

review.title: “I love my job”
review.pros: Pros – Awesome boss, great hours, mostly good co workers.
review.cons: Cons – lazy co-worker and not enough money.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Circle K is not a terrible employer, as far as convenience stores go.”
review.pros: Pros – Circle K helped me to grow from a minimum wage job to a career in management. They promote from within the company, making it possible for someone with no college education, like me, to be successful.
review.cons: Cons – Circle K does not treat their lower level employees, like cashiers, very well. They have high performance expectations for low pay. And their benefit package is terrible for store employees.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay these poor cashiers more! Or at least give raises more often, maybe performance based? I get paid pretty good, but my employees do not.

review.title: “In under a year I've received 3 raises and 2 promotions.”

review.cons: Cons – Dealing with belligerent customers and lazy coworkers are the only really tough things that have to be dealt with at CK.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give some people a chance. Just because someone had a dui charge 10 years ago is no reason to not allow them the chance to make a living.

review.title: “Discussed”
review.pros: Pros – you get to know really nice customers and they will be very miss when you are know longer working there
review.cons: Cons – If you have I any kinda of injury after being employed they let you go
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Maybe you should be an equal opportunity employer instead of picking and chosen your employees I've worked for this company for 5 yrs and because i had a back injury in Feb and which your company still let me work up until Oct. 2012 then decided to let me go. Because your company doesn't promote light duty there's your loyalty to employee's and you guy's need to train your management to have come compassion towards there employee's

review.title: “Easy to get a job here...”

review.cons: Cons – Work alone with no backup, cannot move up unless available to work multiple shifts, minimum wage.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay a living wage to hard workers, advance hard workers not just kids with more flexible schedules, stop cutting hours (it takes more than 200 hours a week to run a 24 hour store).

review.cons: Cons – Can be dangerous at night in some areas.Customers who get mad at you because they cant pay for gas/items.Usually part-time only, some full time.People treat you like mud.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – If your employee has a family, have a little bit of a heart. Life happens.

review.title: “getting unorganized”
review.pros: Pros – Benifeits and they have a great training process.was very happy until they had a change in managment,they seem to gone down hill from this and lost a lot of good managers, this past year.

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – just because you feel pressure from upper management doesnt mean that you should take out that frustration on everybody on the store level

review.title: “Store Manager”
review.pros: Pros – I was able to work with hard working employees.
review.cons: Cons – High labor turnover!! No matter how hard you work for this company, you are underpaid and not appreciated.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Upper management is so detached & people at the store are so under appreciated. Make goals that are attainable. Be involved & seek suggestions from store management or store personnel. Too much petty policies are coming out of corporate that store personnel are having a difficult time accomplishing these goals. Teach what you preach!!!! And walk the talk!!

review.title: “sub-par”

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You need to focus on your employees. Circle K has become a horrible, and insensitive work environment. Many if not all of you have no idea what it is to actually work in one of your stores, and the attitude you have to those of us that do is despicable. I am incredibly disappointed in each and everyone of you and you should be ashamed of yourselves

review.title: “k”
review.pros: Pros – nice hour when you are in management
review.cons: Cons – - k never closes 365 days a year
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – more competive pay for less than store manager status

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I like my boss he is cool

review.pros: Pros – With such little supervision you can do pretty much whatever you choose.

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay more attention to furthering customer service in each individual, make your employees actually clean their working environment, be more available to employees and praise your employees for jobs well done instead of always criticizing.

review.title: “Last Priority”

The customers are another factor that will shape your overall work experience. Customers are frequently loyal and good relations are important.
review.cons: Cons – The company slowly has eliminated incentives, bonuses, and even the number of work hours. Basically, after 5 years of service, I was making less money than the day I started.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Job satisfaction should be a priority for your employees. They are the front line to your customers, and unhappy workers reflect poorly on the quality of service your customers receive. Turn-over rates, employee loyalty, and shrinkage can all be positively affected through a focus on making your employees feel valued.

review.title: “Frustrating”

review.cons: Cons – pay, overworked and underpaid......the hours are long and stressful most of the time!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Remember what it was like when you were in the store working, it seems they move up to office positions and forget the chaos that is involved on a daily basis at the store level,be available when there are situations and we need help!

review.title: “A waste of time”
review.pros: Pros – They have good benefits if you want to pay for them. They are good with time off, if you need it.
review.cons: Cons – The have the most disgusting locations and care very little for their employees safety. This is especially true for those working overnight.

review.cons: Cons – the pay isn't great but you can chage it with time

review.title: “A place to be mediocre”

review.pros: Pros – -Hours were decent; time off fairly easy to get with enough notice-Free refills on drinks during shifts-Interesting and amusing customers-Easy workWorking at a gas station is rarely considered a fun job, but I enjoyed it a lot of the time. Depending on where and when you work, it might be good for a student. Though there were busy times, some days were completely dead, so a student might appreciate the time they have to study, since once you're done with your necessary tasks you won't have anything else to do.
review.cons: Cons – -Usually scheduled alone; almost impossible to get breaks/use the restroom-Boring - the work is easy, but if it's slow you'll have to find something to fill your timeSince you're usually scheduled alone, you'll have to deal with rush hours by yourself. Most hours are slow, but you'll get rushes that last for a while where you might have a line of customers ten people deep. For second shift workers there's a concern as to whether or not the overnight person will come in. There are less than 10 people on staff, so if they decide not to answer their phones, you'll be stuck overnight.Customers can be a con, as many of them are under the impression that gas station attendants are all high school dropouts unable to count. Rushed customers might snap and yell, and lottery customers can create a long wait for other, already impatient customers. Also, some people just don't know how to use a gas pump.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I've heard accounts of several people working for this company being fired for "missing money". When I got fired, and filed for unemployment, even the guy doing the interview for it said that "missing money" is what he hears most often from pepole fired from this company. There's never any explaination, and most of the the managers just tell you over the phone. It's terribly unprofessional, and, most likely, completely false.

review.title: “Circle K - a 800 lb. gorilla with too many independent heads”
review.pros: Pros – Operations team has clearly defined career path for their employees, decent benefits for non store employees (when compared to similar companies), company is aggressive in expanding into new geographic territories. Company has strong tradition of promoting within at the business unit level.
review.cons: Cons – Couche Tard is broken up into separate business units across the US and Canada. Some units are very similar culturally (especially the heritage Circle K units) because of Couche Tard's tradition of absorbing stores and leaving operation teams in place. The company does very well on revenue generation and M&A, but the independence of the business units (roughly 500 stores each) strains the lean retail business model that Couche Tard has become famous for. The regions often have different operating structures, accounting systems, advertising, global purchasing, fiscal responsibility, marketing programs, fuel agreements that under cut any "clout" that management can muster by using CT as a single company. Couche Tard's reputation of being driven to save money on the front end has given them an impression in the industry of being cheap at any cost. This is great for quarterly/yearly results, but the rapid growth has hidden the long term sunk costs in overhead and operating costs of constantly negotiating service contracts, buying new software, marketing systems and purchase agreements.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The company has nearly 6000 company owned sites. If we are serious about cutting overhead and operating costs, let's start acting like the 800 lb. gorilla that we are! Use our clout to get the BEST at the best price, not the cheapest thing right now and hope that in 2 years we can put it out for bid again and get it cheap again while ignoring the switching cost (hidden because it gets dumped to the regions to handle with their R&M budget). If there is a long term company strategy, it is not being communicated well down to the workers. Cut costs, buy more stores! is the message that is being heard on the front line.

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stay more connected to even the low level people. For the most part, upper management seemed out of touch with what was going on with most employees. Training was also an issue for me. I hit the ground running without much direction.

When you are robbed at gunpoint you are told you have to stay until the end of your shift and are yelled at for having more money (or any money) in your register, you are not offered any couseling, you are just expected to go on as usual. The management that constantly belittles you and attacks you and tells you you aren't doing enough. And if you have to take off a day due to being sick be prepared to be yelled at some more and then put on a schedule without a day off for 2-3 weeks.
